data: Здравствуйте, у меня вопрос по вашему товару "Стекло защитное для смартфонов", артикул 11223. Подойдет ли он на данную [ модель ](https://www.ozon.ru/product/smartfon-samsung-galaxy-a03s-4-64-gb-chernyy) телефона?

post.description:
Available to sellers with the [Premium Plus](https://docs.ozon.ru/global/en/promotion/subscriptions) or Premium Pro subscription.

A method for marking the selected message and messages before it as read.

Specify the period and metrics that are required. The response will contain analytical data grouped by the `dimensions` parameter.

There are restrictions for sellers without the [Premium Plus](https://docs.ozon.ru/global/en/promotion/subscriptions) or Premium Pro subscription:
- data is available for the last 3 months,
- some of the data grouping methods and metrics aren't available.

There are no restrictions for sellers with [Premium Plus](https://docs.ozon.ru/global/en/promotion/subscriptions) or Premium Pro subscription.

You can use the method for no more than 1 request per minute.
Matches the **Analytics → Graphs** section in your personal account.

post.summary: Get details on your product queries
post.description:
Use the method to get data about your product queries. Full analytics is available with the [Premium](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/premium-program), [Premium Plus](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/subscription-premium-plus), or [Premium Pro](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/podpiska-premium-pro) subscription. Without subscription, you can see a part of the metrics. The method is similar to the **Products in Search → Queries for my product** tab in your personal account.

You can view analytics by queries for certain dates. To do this, specify the interval in the `date_from` and `date_to` fields. Data for the last month are available in any interval except for three days from the current date because these days the calculation is performed. Analytics for dates later than a month ago is available only with the [Premium](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/premium-program), [Premium Plus](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/subscription-premium-plus), and [Premium Pro](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/podpiska-premium-pro) subscription, and only by weeks. Specify the `date_from` parameter in the request.

Use the method to get details on product-specific queries. Full analytics is available with [Premium](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/premium-program), [Premium Plus](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/subscription-premium-plus), or [Premium Pro](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/podpiska-premium-pro) subscription. Without a subscription, you can view a part of the metrics. Method is similar to viewing product details in the **Products in search → Requests for my product** tab in your personal account.

You can view analytics by queries for certain dates. To do this, specify the interval in the `date_from` and `date_to` fields. Data for the last month are available in any interval except for three days from the current date because these days the calculation is performed. Analytics for dates later than a month ago is available only with the [Premium](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/premium-program), [Premium Plus](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/subscription-premium-plus), or [Premium Pro](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/podpiska-premium-pro) subscription, and only by weeks. Specify the `date_from` parameter in the request.

Available to sellers with the [Premium Plus](https://docs.ozon.ru/global/en/promotion/subscriptions) or Premium Pro subscription.

Returns sales amount data from the [sales report](#operation/FinanceAPI_GetRealizationReportV2) per day. Canceled or non-purchased products aren't included. Data is available for a maximum of 32 calendar days from the current date.

200.description: List of shipment items with labels

roles.description: Information about available roles and methods.

languageLanguage.description:
Response language:
- `EN`—English,
- `RU`—Russian,
- `TR`—Turkish,
- `ZH_HANS`—Chinese.

The default language is Russian.
languageLanguage.title: object

disabled.description: `true`, if you can't create products in the category. `false`, if you can.

description_category_id.description: Category identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method.

type_id.description: Product type identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method.

category_dependent.description:
Indication that the dictionary attribute values depend on the category:
- `true`—the attribute has its own set of values for each category.
- `false`—the attribute has the same set of values for all categories.

is_aspect.description:
Indicates that the attribute is aspect. An aspect attribute is a characteristic that distinguishes products of the same model.

For example, clothes or shoes of the same model may have different colors and sizes. That is, color and size are aspect attributes.

Values description:
- `true`—the attribute is aspect and can't be changed after the products are delivered to the warehouse or sold from the seller's warehouse.
- `false`—the attribute is not aspect and can be changed at any time.

is_collection.description:
Indicates that the characteristic is a set of values:
 - `true`—the characteristic is a set of values,
 - `false`—the characteristic consists of a single value.

is_required.description:
Indicates that the characteristic is mandatory:
 - `true`—a mandatory characteristic,
 - `false`—an optional characteristic.

max_value_count.description: Maximum number of values for attribute.

complex_is_collection.description:
Indicates that the complex characteristic is a set of values:
 - `true`—the complex characteristic is a set of values,
 - `false`—the complex characteristic consists of a single value.

attribute_id.description: Characteristics identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/attribute](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetAttributes) method.

description_category_id.description: Category identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method.

last_value_id.description: Identifier of the directory to start the response with. If `last_value_id` is 10, the response will contain directories starting from the 11th.

limit.description:
Number of values in the response:
 - maximum—2000,
 - minimum—1.

type_id.description: Product type identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method.

attribute_id.description: Characteristic identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/attribute](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetAttributes) method.

description_category_id.description: Category identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method.

limit.description: Number of values in the response. The minimum value is 1, the maximum is 100.

type_id.description: Product type identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method.

value.description: By this value the system searches for reference values. It must be at least 2 characters.

complex_id.description: Identifier of the characteristic that supports nested properties. For example, the "Processor" characteristic has nested characteristics "Manufacturer", "L2 Cache", and others. Each of the nested characteristics can have multiple value variants.

operation.description:
Attribute for action with promotion:
- `ENABLE`—enable,
- `DISABLE`—disable,
- `UNKNOWN`—no changes, passed by default.

attributes.description: Array with the product characteristics. The characteristics depend on category. You can view them in [Help Center](https://global.ozon.ru/en/docs/products/required-characteristics.html) or via API.

color_image.description:
Marketing color.

Pass the link to the image in the public cloud storage. The image format is JPG.

complex_attributes.description: Array of characteristics that have nested attributes.

currency_code.description:
Currency of your prices. The passed value must be the same as the one set in the personal account settings. 
By default, the passed value is `RUB`, Russian ruble.

For example, if your currency set in the settings is yuan, pass the value `CNY`, otherwise an error will be returned.

Possible values:      
  - `RUB`—Russian ruble,
  - `BYN`—Belarusian ruble,
  - `KZT`—tenge,
  - `EUR`—euro,
  - `USD`—US dollar,
  - `CNY`—yuan.

description_category_id.description: Category identifier. You can get it using the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method.

new_description_category_id.description: New category identifier. Specify it if you want to change the current product category.

geo_names.description:
Geo-restrictions — fill in the parameter in your personal account when creating or editing a product.

Optional parameter.

images.description:
Array of images, up to 30 files. The images are displayed on the site in the same order as they are in the array.

The first one will be set as the main image for the product if the `primary_image` parameter is not specified. 

If you use the `primary_image` parameter, the maximum number of images is 29. If the `primary_image` parameter is not specified, you can upload up to 30 images.

Pass links to images in the public cloud storage. The image format is JPG or PNG.

images360.description:
Array of 360 images—up to 70 files.

Pass links to images in the public cloud storage. The image format is JPG.

name.description:
Product name. Up to 500 characters.

[Learn more about product name requirements](https://docs.ozon.ru/global/en/products/requirements/product-info/naming-requirements/)

offer_id.description:
Product identifier in the seller's system.

The maximum length of a string is 50 characters.

old_price.description:
Price before discounts. Displayed strikethrough on the product description page. Specified in rubles. The fractional part is separated by decimal point, up to two digits after the decimal point.

If you specified the `old_price` before and updated the `price` parameter you should update the `old_price` too.

price.description: Product price including discounts. This value is shown on the product description card. If there are no discounts on the product, specify the `old_price` value.

type_id.description:
Product type identifier.
You can get values from the type_id parameter in the [/v1/description-category/tree](#operation/DescriptionCategoryAPI_GetTree) method response.
When filling this parameter in, you can leave out the `attributes` attribute if it has the `id:8229` parameter.

vat.description:
VAT rate for the product:
 - `0`—not subject to VAT,
 - `0.05`—5%,
 - `0.07`—7%,
 - `0.1`—10%,
 - `0.2`—20%.

Pass the rate value that is currently valid.

weight.description: Product weight with the package. The limit value is 1000 kilograms or a corresponding converted value in other measurement units.

task_id.description: Identifier of the task for uploading products. Check the product creation or update status using the [/v1/product/import/info](#operation/ProductAPI_GetImportProductsInfo) method.
Importing products task code. You can get it using the [/v3/product/import](#operation/ProductAPI_ImportProductsV3) method.

offer_id.description:
Product identifier in the seller's system.

The maximum length of a string is 50 characters.

errors.description: Array of errors.

total.description: Product identifier in the seller's system.

offer_id.description:
Product identifier in the seller's system.

The maximum length of a string is 50 characters.

old_price.description: Price before discounts. Displayed strikethrough on the product description page. Specified in rubles. The fractional part is separated by decimal point, up to two digits after the decimal point.

price.description: Product price including discounts. This value is shown on the product description page. If there are no discounts, pass the `old_price` value in this parameter.

currency_code.description:
Currency of your prices. The passed value must be the same as the one set in the personal account settings. 
By default, the passed value is `RUB`, Russian ruble.

For example, if your currency set in the settings is yuan, pass the value `CNY`, otherwise an error will be returned.

Possible values:      
  - `RUB`—Russian ruble,
  - `BYN`—Belarusian ruble,
  - `KZT`—tenge,
  - `EUR`—euro,
  - `USD`—US dollar,
  - `CNY`—yuan.

sku.description: Product identifier in the Ozon system, SKU.

vat.description:
VAT rate for the product:
 - `0`—not subject to VAT,
 - `0.05`—5%,
 - `0.07`—7%,
 - `0.1`—10%,
 - `0.2`—20%.

Pass the rate value that is currently valid.

complex_id.description: Identifier of the characteristic that supports nested properties. Each of the nested characteristics can have multiple value variants.

offer_id.description: Product identifier in the seller's system: `product_id`.

items.description: Products and characteristics to be updated.

task_id.description:
Products update task code.

To check the update status, pass the received value to the [/v1/product/import/info](#operation/ProductAPI_GetImportProductsInfo) method.

images.description:
Array of links to images, up to 30 links. The images in the array are arranged in the order of their arrangement on the site. The first image in the list is the main one for the product.

Pass links to images in the public cloud storage. The image format is JPG.

product_id.description: Product identifier in the seller's system: `product_id`.

state.description:
Image uploading status. 

If the [/v1/product/pictures/import](#operation/ProductAPI_ProductImportPictures) method was called, the response will always be `imported`—image not processed.
To see the final status, call the [/v1/product/pictures/info](#operation/ProductAPI_ProductInfoPictures) method after about 10 seconds.

If you called the [/v1/product/pictures/info](#operation/ProductAPI_ProductInfoPictures) method, one of the statuses will appear:
- `uploaded`—image uploaded;

auto_action_enabled.description:
Attribute for promotions auto-application:
- `ENABLED`—enable.
- `DISABLED`—disable.
- `UNKNOWN`—don't change anything. Default value.

If you've previously enabled automatic application of promotions and don't want to disable it, pass `UNKNOWN`.

If you pass `ENABLED` in this parameter, specify the minimum price in the `min_price` parameter.

currency_code.description:
Currency of your prices. The passed value must be the same as the one set in the personal account settings. 
By default, the passed value is `RUB`, Russian ruble.

For example, if your currency set in the settings is yuan, pass the value `CNY`, otherwise an error will be returned.

Possible values:      
  - `RUB`—Russian ruble,
  - `BYN`—Belarusian ruble,
  - `KZT`—tenge,
  - `EUR`—euro,
  - `USD`—US dollar,
  - `CNY`—yuan.

manage_elastic_boosting_through_price.description:
Manage participation in the "Elastic Boosting" promotion:

- `true`: automatically adds the product to the promotion or increases its discount and boosting if the `price` parameter value meets the promotion conditions;
- `false`: changing the `price` parameter value doesn't affect participation in the promotion.

If you don't pass anything, the participation status remains the same.

min_price.description: Minimum product price with all promotions applied.

min_price_for_auto_actions_enabled.description: `true`, if Ozon takes into account the minimum price when creating promotions. If you don't pass anything, the status of the price accounting remains the same.

offer_id.description: Product identifier in the seller's system.

old_price.description:
Price before discounts. Displayed strikethrough on the product description page. Specified in rubles. The fractional part is separated by decimal point, up to two digits after the decimal point.

If there are no discounts on the product, pass `0` to this field and specify the correct price in the `price` field.

price.description:
Product price including discounts. This value is displayed on the product description page.

If the `old_price` parameter value is greater than 0, there should be a certain difference between `price` and `old_price`.
It depends on the `price` value.

| `price` value | Minimum difference |
|---|---|
| < 400 | 20 rubles |
| 400–10 000 | 5% |
| > 10 000 | 500 rubles |

price_strategy_enabled.description:
Attribute for enabling and disabling pricing strategies auto-application:
- `ENABLED`—enable.
- `DISABLED`—disable.
- `UNKNOWN`—don't change anything. Default value.

If you've previously enabled automatic application of pricing strategies and don't want to disable it, pass `UNKNOWN` in the next requests.

If you pass `ENABLED` in this parameter, specify the minimum price in the `min_price` parameter.

If you pass `DISABLED` in this parameter, the product is removed from the strategy.

quant_size.description:
Use parameter if the regular and economy products have the same article code—`offer_id = quant_id`. To update price of the:
 - regular product, pass the `1` value;
 - economy product, pass the size of its MOQ.

 If the regular and economy products have different article codes, don't specify the parameter.

vat.description:
VAT rate for the product:
 - `0`—not subject to VAT,
 - `0.05`—5%,
 - `0.07`—7%,
 - `0.1`—10%,
 - `0.2`—20%.

Pass the rate value that is currently valid.

updated.description: If the product details have been successfully updated—`true`.

min_price_for_auto_actions_enabled.description: `true`, if Ozon takes into account the minimum price when creating promotions.

Warehouse status.

How warehouse statuses match with the statuses in the personal account:

|---|---|

| `disabled` | Archived |

| `disabled_due_to_limit` | On pause |

  - `INVALID_SUPPLY_STATE`: incorrect supply status.
  - `SUPPLY_DOES_NOT_BELONG_TO_CONTRACTOR`: supply doesn't belong to the legal entity.
  - `SUPPLY_DOES_NOT_BELONG_TO_COMPANY`: supply doesn't belong to the seller.
  - `SUPPLY_DOES_NOT_BELONG_TO_ORDER`: supply doesn't belong to the supply request.
  - `SUPPLY_BELONGS_TO_VIRTUAL_ORDER`: supply belongs to the virtual supply request.
  - `OTHER_ASYNCHRONOUS_OPERATION_IN_PROGRESS`: supply is being canceled.

  - `ORDER_IS_VIRTUAL`: request is virtual. 
  - `ORDER_DOES_NOT_BELONG_TO_CONTRACTOR`: supply request doesn't belong to the legal entity.
  - `ORDER_DOES_NOT_BELONG_TO_COMPANY`: supply request doesn't belong to the seller. 
  - `OTHER_ASYNCHRONOUS_OPERATION_IN_PROGRESS`: supply request is being canceled.

departure_date.description:
Shipping date. To make documents printing available before the shipping day, enable **Printing the acceptance certificate in advance** in your personal account under the method settings. The time for packaging (packaging SLA) should be more than 13 hours. **Examples** - Shipping is on the next day: packaging ends tomorrow at 13:00. If packaging time is 15 hours, then shipping is formed at 13:00 - 15 hours + 1 minute = 22:01 today. From this time on you can print an acceptance certificate.
- Shipping after the weekend: packaging ends on Monday at 13:00. The warehouse is closed on Saturdays and Sundays. If packaging time is 15 hours, then shipping is formed at 13:00 - 15 hours + 1 minute = 22:01 on Friday. From this time on you can print an acceptance certificate.
- Packaging time is less than 13 hours: packaging ends tomorrow at 13:00. If packaging time is 10 hours, then shipping is formed at 13:00 - 10 часов + 1 минута = 03:01 tomorrow. Shipments received before 03:00 should be handed in on the same day. So the acceptance certificate can be printed only on a shipping day.

status.description:
Request status:
 - `in_process`—documents generation in process, please wait.
 - `ready`—documents are ready for downloading.
 - `error`—error occured during document geneartion process. Send a request again.
 - `cancelled`—documents generation was canceled. Send a request again.
 - `The next postings aren't ready`—error occured, shipmants are not included in the shipping. Wait and check request results again. If you see the error again, contact our support team.

is_partial.description:
Indication of a partial shipping. `true` if the shipping is partial.

Shipping is partial when it was split into several parts and you need to generate separate acceptance and transfer certificates for each of them.

has_postings_for_next_carriage.description:
`true` if there are shipments subject to shipping that are not in the current shipping.

If there are such shipments, create a new acceptance and transfer certificate using the [/v2/posting/fbs/act/create](#operation/PostingAPI_PostingFBSActCreate) method and check the creation status. Create acts until this field returns `false`.

Request filter.

Use either the `cutoff` filter or the `delivering_date` filter. If you use them together, an error will be returned in the response.

To use the packing time filter, fill in the `cutoff_from` and `cutoff_to` fields.

To use the filter by date when shipment should be handed over for delivery, fill in the `delivering_date_from` and `delivering_date_to` fields.

RowItemLegalEntityDocument.description: Information on sale to a legal entity.

commission_ratio.description: Percentage of sales commission by category.

transaction_type.description:
Transaction type:
  - `all`—all,
  - `orders`—orders,
  - `returns`—returns and cancellations,
  - `services`—service fees,
  - `compensation`—compensation,
  - `transferDelivery`—delivery cost,
  - `other`—other.

Some operations may be separated in time. For example, when accepting a return from the customer, the product cost is charged and the commission is refunded, and when the product is returned to the warehouse, the return processing service fee is charged.

page.description: Number of the page returned in the request.

page_size.description: Number of items on the page.

sku.description: Product identifier in the Ozon system, SKU.

delivery_schema.description:
Delivery scheme:
  - `FBO`—delivery to Ozon warehouse,
  - `FBS`—delivery from seller's warehouse,
  - `CROSSBORDER`—cross-border delivery,
  - `RFBS`—delivery service of seller's choice,
  - `FBP`—delivery from Ozon partner warehouses.
  - `FBOECONOMY`—delivery of economy products from Ozon warehouse,
  - `FBSECONOMY`—delivery of economy products from your warehouse.

order_date.description: Date the product was accepted for processing.

name.description:
Service name:
  - `MarketplaceNotDeliveredCostItem`—return of unclaimed products from the customer to the warehouse.
  - `MarketplaceReturnAfterDeliveryCostItem`—return from the customer to the warehouse after delivery.
  - `MarketplaceDeliveryCostItem`—product delivery to the customer.
  - `MarketplaceSaleReviewsItem`—purchasing reviews on the platform.
  - `ItemAdvertisementForSupplierLogistic`—products delivery to the Ozon warehouse (cross docking).
  - `OperationMarketplaceServiceStorage`—product placement service.
  - `MarketplaceMarketingActionCostItem`—products promotion.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemInstallment`—promotion and selling on an instalment plan.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemMarkingItems`—mandatory products labeling.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemFlexiblePaymentSchedule`—flexible payment schedule.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemReturnFromStock`—picking up products for removal by the seller.
  - `ItemAdvertisementForSupplierLogisticSeller`—forwarding trade.
  - `ItemAgentServiceStarsMembership`—["Star products"](https://s.ozon.ru/e7NlR6b) service fee.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDelivToCustomer`—last mile.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDirectFlowTrans`—pipeline.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDropoffFF`—shipment processing.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDropoffPVZ`—shipment processing.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDropoffSC`—shipment processing.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemFulfillment`—order packaging.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemPickup`—picking products up by car from the seller's address (Pick-up).
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemReturnAfterDelivToCustomer`—return processing.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemReturnFlowTrans`—reverse pipeline.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemReturnNotDelivToCustomer`—cancellation processing.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemReturnPartGoodsCustomer`—unredeemed order processing.
  - `MarketplaceRedistributionOfAcquiringOperation`—acquiring payment.
  - `MarketplaceReturnStorageServiceAtThePickupPointFbsItem`—FBS return short-term placement.
  - `MarketplaceReturnStorageServiceInTheWarehouseFbsItem`—FBS return long-term placement.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDeliveryKGT`—bulky products delivery.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDirectFlowLogistic`—logistics.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemReturnFlowLogistic`—reverse logistics.
  - `MarketplaceServicePremiumCashbackIndividualPoints`—"Seller's Bonus" promotion service.
  - `MarketplaceServicePremiumPromotion`—Premium promotion service, fixed commission.
  - `OperationMarketplaceWithHoldingForUndeliverableGoods`—withholding for product shortage.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemDropoffPPZ`—drop-off service at the pick-up point.
  - `MarketplaceServiceItemRedistributionReturnsPVZ`—reissue of returns at the pick-up point.
  - `OperationMarketplaceAgencyFeeAggregator3PLGlobal`—Agregator 3PL Globalagency service tariffication.

accruals_for_sale.description: Cost of the products with seller's discounts applied.

delivery_charge.description: Delivery cost for charges by rates that were in effect until February 1, 2021, and for charges for bulky products.

return_delivery_charge.description: Returns and cancellation cost for charges by rates that were in effect until February 1, 2021, and for charges for bulky products.

sale_commission.description: Sales commission or sales commission refund.

type.description:
Transaction type:
  - `all`—all,
  - `orders`—orders,
  - `returns`—returns and cancellations,
  - `services`—service fees,
  - `compensation`—compensation,
  - `transferDelivery`—delivery cost,
  - `other`—other.

page_count.description: Number of pages. If 0, there are no more pages.

row_count.description: Number of transactions on all pages. If 0, there are no more transactions.

transaction_type.description:
Transaction type:
  - `all`—all,
  - `orders`—orders,
  - `returns`—returns and cancellations,
  - `services`—service fees,
  - `compensation`—compensation,
  - `transferDelivery`—delivery cost,
  - `other`—other.

accruals_for_sale.description: Total cost of products and returns for specified period.

money_transfer.description: Charges for delivery and returns when working under rFBS scheme.

processing_and_delivery.description:
Cost of shipment processing, orders packaging, pipeline and last mile services, and delivery cost before the new commissions and rates applied from February 1, 2021.

Pipeline is delivery of products from one cluster to another.

Last mile is products delivery to the pick-up point, parcle terminal, or by courier.

refunds_and_cancellations.description:
Cost of reverse pipeline, returned, canceled and unredeemed orders processing, and return cost before the new commissions and rates applied from February 1, 2021.

Pipeline is delivery of products from one cluster to another.

Last mile is products delivery to the pick-up point, parcle terminal, or by courier.

sale_commission.description: The commission withheld when the product was sold and refunded when the product was returned.

services_amount.description: The  additional services cost that are not directly related to deliveries and returns. For example, promotion or product placement.

date.description: Reporting period in the `YYYY-MM` format. The report is available up to and including January 2019.
Seller's invoice date in the `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

RatingItemChange.title: object
RatingItemChange.description: Rating change: the ratio of the previous value to the current one.

direction.description:
How the rating value has changed:
- `DIRECTION_UNKNOWN`—unknown.
- `DIRECTION_NONE`—hasn't changed.
- `DIRECTION_RISE`—has increased.
- `DIRECTION_FALL`—has dropped.

meaning.description:
What the change means:
- `MEANING_UNKNOWN`—unknown.
- `MEANING_NONE`—neutral.
- `MEANING_GOOD`—the indicator is improving, everything is good.
- `MEANING_BAD`—the indicator is dropping, you should do something.

rating_direction.description:
What should be the rating value to be considered good:
- `UNKNOWN_DIRECTION`—unknown.
- `NEUTRAL`—doesn't matter.
- `HIGHER_IS_BETTER`—the higher the better.
- `LOWER_IS_BETTER`—the lower the better.

status.description:
Rating status:
- `UNKNOWN_STATUS`—unknown status.
- `OK`—everything is OK.
- `WARNING`—indicators require attention.
- `CRITICAL`—critical rating.

localization_index.description: Localization index details. If you had no sales in the last 14 days, the parameter fields will be empty.

penalty_score_exceeded.description: An indication that the penalty points balance is exceeded.

premium.description: An indication that you have the [Premium](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/premium-program) subscription.

premium_plus.description: An indication that you have the [Premium Plus](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/seller-rating/about-rating/subscription-premium-plus) subscription.

ratings.description:
Filter by rating.

Ratings for which you want to get a value for the period:

- `rating_on_time`: the percentage of orders completed on time in the last 30 days.
- `rating_review_avg_score_total`: the average products score.
- `rating_ssl`: FBO performance evaluation. Considers `rating_on_time_supply_delivery`, `rating_on_time_supply_cancellation` and `rating_order_accuracy`.
- `rating_on_time_supply_delivery`: the percentage of shipments that have arrived to the warehouse in the selected time slot in the last 60 days.
- `rating_order_accuracy`: the percentage of deliveries without surplus, shortages, misgrading, and defective products in the last 60 days.
- `rating_on_time_supply_cancellation`: the percentage of supply requests that ended or were canceled without delay in the last 60 days.
- `rating_reaction_time`: time in seconds customers have waited on average for a response to their first chat message in the last 30 days.
- `rating_average_response_time`: time in seconds customers have waited on average for your response in the last 30 days.
- `rating_replied_dialogs_ratio`: the percentage of dialogs with at least one of your responses within 24 hours in the last 30 days.
- `rating_general_indicator_fbs_rfbs`: FBS and rFBS error index.
- `rating_price_green`: favorable price index.
- `rating_price_yellow`: moderate price index.
- `rating_price_red`: unfavorable price index.
- `rating_price_super`: super favorable price index.

If you want to get information on penalty points for the `rating_on_time` and `rating_review_avg_score_total` ratings,
pass the values of the desired ratings in this parameter and `with_premium_scores=true`.

with_premium_scores.description: Indication that the response should contain information about Premium program penxalty points.

date.description: Date when the penalty points were received.

rating_value.description: Rating value for which the penalty points were received.

danger.description: Indication if the rating threshold for blocking is exceeded.

premium.description: Indication whether the threshold for participation in the Premium program has been reached.

warning.description: Indication of a warning that the threshold for blocking may be exceeded.

danger_threshold.description: Rating threshold, after which sales will be blocked.

premium_threshold.description: Rating threshold for participation in the Premium program.

warning_threshold.description: Rating threshold, after which a warning about possible blocking appears.

premium_scores.description: Information on the Premium program penalty points.

exemplar_keys.description: List of digital product codes. The number of codes must match the `exemplar_qty` parameter.

exemplar_qty.description:
Number of digital product codes you pass to the customer.

The sum of `exemplar_qty` and `not_available_exemplar_qty` must equal the number of codes in the order. You can get this value from the `required_qty_for_digital_code` parameter in the [/v1/posting/digital/list](#operation/ListPostingCodes) method response.

not_available_exemplar_qty.description:
Number of digital product codes that you cannot pass to the customer.

The sum of `exemplar_qty` and `not_available_exemplar_qty` must equal the number of codes in the order. You can get this value from the `required_qty_for_digital_code` parameter in the [/v1/posting/digital/list](#operation/ListPostingCodes) method response.

stock_types.description:
The type of item in stock:
- `STOCK_TYPE_VALID` : valid products. The stock of products available for sale. 
- `STOCK_TYPE_WAITING_DOCS`: waiting for documents. The stock of products that Ozon cannot sell until the seller has sent Ozon the mandatory labelling documents. Products will move to the valid stock when the documents are signed.
- `STOCK_TYPE_EXPIRING`: near-expired products. The stock of products that has been removed from by seller but has not formally expired.
- `STOCK_TYPE_DEFECT`: defective products. The stock of products that is in Ozon's warehouses but damaged.

turnover_grades.description:
Filter by product liquidity status:      
- `TURNOVER_GRADE_NONE`: product has no liquidity status.      
- `DEFICIT`: product in short supply. There's enough stock for up to 28 days.
- `POPULAR`: very popular product. There's enough stock for 28–56 days.
- `ACTUAL`: popular product. There's enough stock for 56–120 days.
- `SURPLUS`: surplus product. Product has little sales, there's enough stock for more than 120 days.
- `NO_SALES`: no sales for the last 28 days.
- `WAS_NO_SALES`: has been out of stock and with no sales for the last 28 days.
- `RESTRICTED_NO_SALES`: has had no sales for over 120 days. You [can't add](https://seller-edu.ozon.ru/fbo/rabota-so-stokom/nehodovye-tovary) this product to a shipment.
- `COLLECTING_DATA`: data collection. To calculate liquidity of a new product, we collect data on it within 60 days after supply.
- `WAITING_FOR_SUPPLY`: awaiting supply. There's no stock available for sale. Supply the product to start data collection.
- `WAS_DEFICIT`: product has been in short supply for the last 56 days. Currently out of stock.
- `WAS_POPULAR`: product has been very popular for the last 56 days. Currently out of stock.
- `WAS_ACTUAL`: product has been popular for the last 56 days. Currently out of stock.
- `WAS_SURPLUS`: product has been surplus for the last 56 days. Currently out of stock.

warehouse_ids.description: Filter by warehouse identifiers. To get identifiers, use the [/v1/warehouse/list](#operation/WarehouseAPI_WarehouseList) method.

- `COLLECTING_DATA`: data collection. To calculate liquidity of a new product, we collect data on it within 60 days after supply.

- `WAS_DEFICIT`: product has been in short supply for the last 56 days. Currently out of stock.
- `WAS_POPULAR`: product has been very popular for the last 56 days. Currently out of stock.

- `COLLECTING_DATA`: data collection. To calculate liquidity of a new product, we collect data on it within 60 days after supply.

text.description: Message text in the plain text format from 1 to 1000 symbols.

direction.description:
Direction of message sorting:
- `Forward`: from old to new.
- `Backward`: from new to old.

The default value is `Backward`. You can set the number of messages in the `limit` parameter.

from_message_id.description:
Identifier of the message from which the chat history is displayed. Default value is the last visible message.

The `from_message_id` parameter is required if `direction = Forward`.

limit.description: Number of messages in the response. The default value is 50. The maximum value is 1000.

data.description: Array with message content in Markdown format.

is_image.description: `true`, if the message has an image.

has_next.description: `true`, if not all messages were returned in the response.

messages.description: Array of messages sorted according to the `direction` parameter in the request body.

unread_count.description: Number of unread messages in the chat.

FilterOp.title: string
FilterOp.description:
Comparison operation:
  - `EQ`—equal,
  - `GT`—greater than,
  - `GTE`—greater than or equal to,
  - `LT`—less than,
  - `LTE`—less than or equal to.

key.description: Sorting parameter. You can pass any attribute from the `dimension` and `metric` parameters except the `brand` attribute.

SortingOrder.title: string
SortingOrder.description:
Sorting type:
  - `ASC`—in ascending order,
  - `DESC`—in descending order.

key.description: Metric by which the method result will be sorted.

date_from.description: Date from which the data will be in the report.

date_to.description: Date up to which the data will be in the report.

dimension.description:
Data grouping in the report.

Data grouping available to all sellers:
  - `unknownDimension`—unknown,
  - `sku`—product identifier,
  - `spu`—identifier for merged products,
  - `day`—day,
  - `week`—week,
  - `month`—month.

Data grouping available to sellers with Premium subscription:
  - `year`—year,
  - `category1`—first level category,
  - `category2`—second level category,
  - `category3`—third level category,
  - `category4`—fourth level category,
  - `brand`—brand,
  - `modelID`—model.

limit.description:
Number of items in the response:
  - maximum is 1000,
  - minimum is 1.

metrics.description:
Specify up to 14 metrics. If there are more, you will get an error with the `InvalidArgument` code.

The list of metrics for which the report will be generated.

Metrics available to all sellers:
  - `revenue`—ordered amount,      
  - `ordered_units`—ordered products.

Metrics available to sellers with Premium subscription:
  - `unknown_metric`—unknown metric.
  - `hits_view_search`—impressions in search and category.
  - `hits_view_pdp`—impressions on the PDP.
  - `hits_view`—total impressions.
  - `hits_tocart_search`—added to cart from search or category.
  - `hits_tocart_pdp`—added to cart from the PDP.
  - `hits_tocart`—added to cart total.
  - `session_view_search`—sessions with impressions in search or catalog. Shows the number of unique visitors who viewed the product in the catalog or search results.
  - `session_view_pdp`—sessions with impressions on the product description page. Shows the number of unique visitors who viewed the product on the PDP.
  - `session_view`—sessions total. Shows the number of unique visitors.
  - `conv_tocart_search`—conversion to cart from search or category.
  - `conv_tocart_pdp`—conversion to cart from a PDP.
  - `conv_tocart`—total conversion to cart.
  - `returns`—returned products.
  - `cancellations`—canceled products.
  - `delivered_units`—delivered products.
  - `position_category`—position in search and category.
